ETYMOLOGY: From Scots gowf, from Middle Dutch kolf ('club, stick'), akin to Dutch kolf ('club, bat'). The game itself originated in Scotland.

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: A word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things (common noun), or to name a particular one of these (proper noun).
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: A precision club-and-ball sport in which competing players (or golfers) use various clubs to hit balls into a series of holes on a course in as few strokes as possible.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 一项用球杆击球入洞的精确球类运动，参赛者使用各种球杆，在球场上将球击入一系列洞中，力求用最少杆数完成。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: They spent the afternoon playing golf on the new course.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 他们在新球场上打了一个下午的高尔夫。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: A word or phrase that describes an action, state, or occurrence.
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: To play the game of golf.
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: He loves to golf every weekend.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 他喜欢每个周末去打高尔夫球。
